citation.article-title: Dethiosulfovibrio peptidovorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a new anaerobic, slightly halophilic, thiosulfate-reducing bacterium from corroding offshore oil wells.

p.s: Dethiosulfovibrio (De.thi.o.sul.fo.vi'bri.o.L. pref. de, from; Gr. n. thios, sulfur; L. n. sulfur, sulfur; thiosulfo, thiosulfate; L. v. vibrio, to vibrate; M.L. masc. n. vibrio that vibrates, a generic name; M.L. masc. n. Dethiosulfovibrio, a vibrio that reduces thiosulfate)
Cells are gram-negative vibrios, mesophilic, neutrophilic, and slightly halophilic strict anaerobes that use peptides and amino acids, but not sugars, as the sole carbon and energy sources.
The organism uses elemental sulfur and thiosulfate, but not sulfate, as electron acceptors.
Cells do not contain cytochrome or desulfoviridin.
